intro: Reseda lutea subsp. eu-lutea, commonly known as yellowrocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the upper leaves are narrower. Its bright yellow flowers, which appear in clusters, bloom from late spring to early summer. The plant is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows.
